org.openadaptor.core.connector
Class CronnablePollingReadConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.core.connector.AbstractPollingReadConnector
          org.openadaptor.core.connector.CronnablePollingReadConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IPollingReadConnector, IReadConnector
public class CronnablePollingReadConnector
extends AbstractPollingReadConnector

This is a IReadConnector that wraps another IReadConnector, it can be configured to poll at fixed intervals or using a cron format. When this connector polls it calls the following on the IReadConnector it is wrapping...

  • IReadConnector.connect()
  • IReadConnector.next(long), until IReadConnector.isDry() returns true
  • IReadConnector.disconnect()
Allows adaptors to poll files, directories, databases rss feeds etc...

This connector operates in the cron mode - uses a crontab like expression to schedule the adaptor polling frequency. See quartz documentation for cron expression format

Author:
Fred Perry, Kris Lachor

Method Detail

setForceInitialPoll

public void setForceInitialPoll(boolean force)
Parameters:
force - if true then an initial poll will be performed as soon as the adaptor starts regardless of the cron settings. After that the polling frequency will be governed by cron.

setCronExpression

public void setCronExpression(java.lang.String s)
Takes a single line crontab entry and schedules the polling accordingly. A crontab entry must be a text string consisting six fields. The fields must be separated by blank characters. The first five fields must be integer patterns that specify the following: 
       Minute (0-59)
       Hour (0-23)
       Day of the month (1-31)
       Month of the year (1-12)
       Day of the week (0-6 with 0=Sunday)
Each of these patterns can be either an asterisk (meaning all valid values), an element or a list of elements separated by commas. An element must be either a number or two numbers separated by a hyphen (meaning an inclusive range). The specification of days can be made by two fields (day of the month and day of the week). If month, day of month and day of week are all asterisks, every day will be matched. If either the month or day of month is specified as an element or list, but the day of week is an asterisk, the month and day of month fields will specify the days that match. If both month and day of month are specified as asterisk, but day of week is an element or list, then only the specified days of the week will match. Finally, if either the month or day of month is specified as an element or list, and the day of week is also specified as an element or list, then any day matching either the month and day of month or the day of week, will be matched.

The sixth field in a crontab entry is traditionally a string that will be executed by the shell at the specified times. In our case it must be a "?" character.

Parameters:
s - a single line containing the crontab entry
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the cron entry is invalid

initTimes

protected void initTimes()
If forceInitialPoll is not set, initialises the startTime to the first event scheduled in cron. The delegates the initialisation to the super class.

Overrides:
initTimes in class AbstractPollingReadConnector

calculateReconnectTime

protected void calculateReconnectTime()
Description copied from class: AbstractPollingReadConnector
Recalculates reconnect time but adding DEFAULT_RECONNECT_INTERVAL to the current reconnectTime. This method will typically be overridden to init times in a connector specific way.

Overrides:
calculateReconnectTime in class AbstractPollingReadConnector
